content.description: Follow Gloo, but go right after the third bolt, and then follow the lip. Pull over the lip at the end of the cave to the anchor above.
content.protection: Protected by 5 bolts. Anchor with chains
content.location: Gloo begins on the right side of the Aqua Cave. The bolt line goes right at the lip. See topo for clarification on the line.

content.description: This route connects Devastator and Gloo. At the lip on Devastator, traverse right to the bolt line for Gloo. From there, follow Gloo over the lip to the anchor. A single bolt protects the traverse between the two routes
content.protection: Protected by 6 bolts. Anchor with chains
content.location: Devastator begins on the left side of the Aqua Cave. See topo for clarification on the line

content.description: One of the longer routes at Emigrant, this route is comprised of 4 bolts and a single gear placement between the first and second bolt. The crack for placements can take gear up to around 1". The climbing tends to be easy when the bolts are spaced out
content.protection: Protected by 4 bolts, and a single gear placement. Anchor with chains
content.location: The climb begins around 20 feet down from the high water mark. The first bolt is quite high, but the climbing is easy to it

content.description: Steep jugs lead to the lip on the right end of the Aqua Cave. Afterwards, follow the slab to the anchor up above. Be careful to not get confused by the variety of bolt lines near the lip. There is a bolt near the lip on the right, but it was intended for Sniff
content.location: Bolt line on the right side of the Aqua Cave. The bolts follow a crack to the lip of the cave

content.description: The hardest route at Emigrant Lake. This route connects the lines of Devastator and Sniff. After traversing across the entire lip of the Aqua Cave, pull over the lip and end at the anchor for all the routes in the Aqua Cave.
content.location: Route begins at Devastator, which is the left bolt line of the Aqua cave. See topo for clarification on the line

content.description: Really steep moves up the left side of the aqua cave lead to a crux at the lip. Pull yourself over and walk up the slab to the anchors up above.
content.location: There is a steep cave near the low point of the wall. The bolt line is the left-most one on the cave

content.description: Difficult moves through the first 20 feet or so, and then easier climbing to an anchor. The bolt lines are really compact in this area, so make sure to stick to the right one!
content.protection: Protected by 4 bolts. Anchor with chains
content.location: Begins just right of the Aqua Cave. The route follows some cracks just beyond the lip of the cave

content.description: The route begins with a nicely bolted ramp, and then opens up into more vertical climbing that is made easier by the large block edges of the wall. The route ends with a nice roof before the anchor. A gear placement is needed to protect the final moves.
content.protection: Protected by 7 bolts, gear placements at the end. Chains for anchor
content.location: Just before the Aqua Cave, there is a slab that runs towards the top of the cave. There are two bolts protecting the opening moves.

content.description: High first bolt with the crux afterwards. The route breaks right to a low anchor. If you continue up, the route becomes Aqua Man
content.protection: Protected by 3 bolts. Anchor with chains
content.location: Furthest right bolt line on the Aqua Wall

content.description:
A steep face at the base of the route holds the crux, but the route eases up afterwards. It is a nice lead for climbers that find the routes of the Poison Oak Wall easy, but are unable to do the routes of the Aqua Cave. 

 A bit over halfways up, there is a large bulge. If you go left, the route is 10b. If you go right, the route is 5.11. See topo for clarification.
content.protection: Protected by 7 bolts. Anchor with chains
content.location: Furthest right bolt line on the Aqua Wall. The first bolt is a ways up, but the climbing to it is easy.

content.description: Location of the harder climbs in the area. Submerged in the water for most of the summer unless water is far down.
